alert.note: Alert for Lake; Porter (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 18 at 11:26AM EST until February 19 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 9 AM CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Areas of blowing and drifting snow expected, especially in open areas, due to wind gusts to 40 mph over freshly fallen snow. * WHERE...Northeast Illinois and portions of northwest Indiana and north central Illinois. * WHEN...From 2 PM this afternoon to 9 AM CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Blowing and drifting snow resulting in snow covered roads, sharply reduced visibility and hazardous travel conditions, primarily in open areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow showers or squalls may accompany the highest gusts along a cold front this evening, with bursts of heavy snow and sudden visibility reductions possible.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Allow extra travel time and expect varying road conditions and visibility in open areas. In Illinois, the latest road conditions can be obtained on the internet at www.gettingaroundillinois.com. In Indiana, the latest road conditions are available by calling 1-800-261-7623.
